gifts and then people go home.

taking their land anyway.

comments.text:
traditional pilgrim thanksgiving has a main dish of turkey, stuffing, 
cranberry sauce, etc. over the centuries americans have added; mac n 
cheese, roast beef or roast chicken, green beans, spinach, and/or corn, 
years' worth of pies and cakes.
comments.author: Aaron Turner

comments.text:
I think what people eat for thanksgiving also depends on the families 
culture, we're Mexican mixed with alot of other cultures but that's the 
main one, and along with turkey stuffing all the American dishes we also 
have tamales, chile con queso, and pan dulce, well had, now that I live in 
Virginia with my husband there's no bakeries that make things like that, I 
have to make everything homemade, along with eveything else :p

top_comment.text: What is thanks-giving﻿
top_comment.author: Christian Radzewicz-Pedersen

comments.text: oooooooohhh thanks for that interesting fact. preciated :D
comments.author: Christian Radzewicz-Pedersen

comments.text:
It's an American holiday on the fourth Thursday of November. Typically, 
family gathers together and has a massive feast of turkey, cranberries, 
green beans, mashed/sweet potatoes, corn, pumpkin pie, etc as a celebration 
of giving thanks for the past year. It's origins stem during the Colonial 
period of America when the English pilgrims were still on friendly terms 
with the Native Americans.  (Of course, that period of time didn't last 
very long and the Europeans eventually committed mass genocide. But 
nonetheless...).

The Native Americans taught the English how to survive the first winter, 
and the following year the pilgrims and Native Americans had a feast 
together. That was the first Thanksgiving.
comments.author: Alana D

captions.text: - I'm Lynn Chen, I'm here with Tyler Malek
of Salt & Straw Ice Cream
and we're at their kitchens to find out

if we can combine Thanksgiving
dinner and dessert into one.
(lively music)
What's happening? We have corn.
- We wanna make corn into ice cream.
We're gonna take this corn.

We're gonna juice it and make
the corn juice into a pudding.
Then put that back in the ice cream.
(lively music)
- Okay, what do we got?
- Cherry, maybe?

- Mmm, there's some sort
of liqueur in there maybe?
Something kinda stingy?
- Pumpkin?
- Oh my God, so good!

- It tastes slightly
alcoholic, is that a thing?
- What is it?
- Honey bourbon corn puddin'.
- I didn't taste the corn.
- Corn, corn pudding?

That's not even a real
dish, is it, corn pudding?
- I had the bourbon at the beginning.
- Verdict is delicious.

- Yes, you can "ice
cream it", that was good.
- Mmm -- mmm, it's definitely pumpkin.
Something pumpkin, but like, REAL pumpkin.
Not pumpkin spice.
This tastes like fuckin' pumpkin.
- I taste pumpkin.
I taste cinnamon.
- That is a complete pumpkin pie.

Crust, pie filling, whip
cream, all in one bite.
- I don't like it, what's in my mouth?
I don't like it.
Can I spit it out?
- Pumpkin, mm-hmm.
- What's that word, spiced chevre?
I don't know what that is.
- I always forget chevre!
- We have a stuffing.

So we imported some brown
bread from New Jersey.
- Exotic.
- Yes, and we're going to candy it
and mix it into an ice cream.
This is the stuffing candy.
We're putting everything together.
These are the walnuts, the cranberries,

everything you can imagine
in a perfect stuffing.
We've got all the ingredients,
let's go spin it into ice cream.
(lively action music)
- It smells like ice cream.
- Stuffing?
- Oh, there are like walnuts in there.

- There's not that much
Thanksgiving flavor coming through,

but there's this like kinda
gross mush in the middle.

- Whatever this is, yes,
you can "ice cream it."

- Stuffing, cranberry walnut
stuffing, I got one, yay!
- I'm gonna give this one a good "meh."
- Cranberry walnut, man.
Yeah.
- Okay, so we have pecans.
- Pecans.
- Or pecans, whatever you call them.
- We're going to praline these.

So praline the pecans for
a sweet potato casserole.
- Sounds good.
(lively action music)

- I feel like I'm inside
a gingerbread house,

so I know there's some sort of
gingerbread in there, right?
- It definitely tastes like pumpkin pie.
- Cranberries, maybe?
- Sweet potatoes!
- Pumpkin, squash?

I don't know what I'm eating,
it's really good though.

- Sweet potato casserole
with maple pecans.
That's incredible.

- The casserole, I don't
know what that's all about.
But yeah.

- Sweet potato casserole
definitely can "ice cream it."
(lively action music)

- There's nothing Thanksgiving
about this by the way.
I don't give a shit, it's delicious.
- This one is not my favorite.
- This is not gross, this is delicious.
What am I eating right now?
- It's got a chunk in it, what is that?
- Some sort of toffee in there?
- Toffee?
- Salted caramel, oh, TURKEY?

- That was delicious, that
was maybe the best one.

I'm not gonna lie, they
kept getting better.

- I didn't taste turkey,
but it was still delicious.
So yes, you can "ice cream that."
- Just because you can put

an entire Thanksgiving meal
together in an ice cream form
doesn't necessary mean that you should.
However, in this case, yes you should.
(lively action music)
